com.rcsexample.basnlib

Class DataProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rcsexample.basnlib.DataProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BluetoothConnectionService.BluetoothConnectionListener, DataFileReader.DataFileReaderListener, PacketDecoder.OnPacketDecodedListener

    public class DataProvider
extends java.lang.Object
implements BluetoothConnectionService.BluetoothConnectionListener, PacketDecoder.OnPacketDecodedListener, DataFileReader.DataFileReaderListener
    This class is used to take care of various data sources and sends them in a unified way, using Data objects.

    The most interesting interface method is DataProvider.OnDataAvailableListener. Choose where data comes from by using the enableXXXProvider() methods. Don't forget to register your class as a listener to receive data.

    Author:
    laurenz

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  DataProvider.OnDataAvailableListener
      Classes that implement this interface and register as a listener (see registerListener(OnDataAvailableListener)) will be able to receive Data objects with this method.

      • enablePhoneSensorProviding

        Parameters:

        See Also:

      • disablePhoneSensorProviding

        public void disablePhoneSensorProviding()

      • enableBluetoothSensorProviding

        public void enableBluetoothSensorProviding(BluetoothConnectionService bluetoothService)
        This enables the DataProvider object to send you data from a Bluetooth sensor.

        The Packets received over Bluetooth rfcomm are decoded internally by a PacketDecoder, so no need to worry about that. You might want to implement your own one though, as this default implementation drops some packets due to CRC errors.

        The methods needs a BluetoothConnectionService reference to handle the Bluetooth connection stuff. So you should instantiate one of those before.

        Parameters:
        bluetoothService - A reference to a BluetoothConnectionService object

      • disableBluetoothSensorProviding

        public void disableBluetoothSensorProviding()
        Stop sending Datas from the bluetooth sensor.

        This does not kill the bluetooth connection, the sensor may still send raw data and it will still be decoded. See BluetoothConnectionService.stop() for that.

      • registerListener

        public void registerListener(DataProvider.OnDataAvailableListener l)
        Register as a listener to receive data via the DataProvider.OnDataAvailableListener interface. The listener you want to register is most likely "this".
        Parameters:
        l - the listener to register

      • unregisterListener

        public void unregisterListener(DataProvider.OnDataAvailableListener l)
        Stop calling the functions of the DataProvider.OnDataAvailableListener interface for the given listener.
        Parameters:
        the - listener to unregister

      • onNewPacketError

        public void onNewPacketError(Packet invalidPacket)
        Description copied from interface: PacketDecoder.OnPacketDecodedListener

        Specified by:
        onNewPacketError in interface PacketDecoder.OnPacketDecodedListener
        Parameters:

      • onBluetoothConnectionReceive

        public void onBluetoothConnectionReceive(byte[] buffer,
                                int numberOfBytesInBuffer)
        This method gets called from the BluetoothConnectionService when new data is received. This method takes the data and passes it to the internal PacketDecoder for decoding. The decoding will happen in a parallel thread.
        Specified by:
        onBluetoothConnectionReceive in interface BluetoothConnectionService.BluetoothConnectionListener
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer that holds the received (raw) data
        numberOfBytesInBuffer - The number of valid bytes in that buffer

      • onBluetoothConnectionWrite

        public void onBluetoothConnectionWrite(byte[] buffer)
        Description copied from interface: BluetoothConnectionService.BluetoothConnectionListener
        When you send something to the device (for example, by using the BluetoothConnectionService.write(byte[]) method), this method gets called with the data you sent.
        Specified by:
        onBluetoothConnectionWrite in interface BluetoothConnectionService.BluetoothConnectionListener
        Parameters:
        buffer - The data sent
